The artwork consists of **four distinct scenes**, each framed and arranged horizontally:

---

### **Left Panel: The Presentation of the Virgin in the Temple**
This scene depicts the young **Virgin Mary**, holding the Christ Child, being presented to the Temple by her parents, **Saint Joachim and Saint Anne**. The figures are shown in a modest, architectural setting, emphasizing the sacred nature of the event.

---

### **Second Panel: The Annunciation**
This is the central and most famous scene: the **Archangel Gabriel** kneels before the **Virgin Mary**, offering her a golden lily and a starburst symbolizing the divine announcement that she will bear the Son of God. prediction.details: The painting is a polyptych (multi-panel altarpiece) created by Fra Angelico around 1430-1435 (database shows 1438). It consists of four distinct scenes arranged horizontally: 1) The Presentation of the Virgin in the Temple - showing young Virgin Mary with the Christ Child being presented by Saint Joachim and Saint Anne; 2) The Annunciation - the central scene depicting Archangel Gabriel kneeling before Virgin Mary, offering her a golden lily and starburst, announcing she will bear the Son of God; 3-4) Additional scenes related to the Life of Saint John the Baptist.
